New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in major league history to reach 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit three home runs, stole two bases, and had 10 RBIs in the Dodgers' 20-4 victory over the Miami Marlins.
Ohtani went six for six in the game.
The Dodgers clinched their 12th consecutive playoff berth with this win.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy described Ohtani's performance as 'insane'.
Mookie Betts expressed amazement at Ohtani's achievements.
Miguel Rojas felt emotional and almost cried witnessing Ohtani's performance.
Manager Dave Roberts commented on Ohtani's uncanny ability to deliver in big moments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers had to rearrange the press box to accommodate the media attention on Ohtani.
Ohtani's bobblehead night caused significant pregame traffic jams.
